markets.title: Will Dome (YC startup) succeed before 2027?
markets.resolution_criteria: YES if achieves by 2026: $5M+ funding, OR $1M+ revenue, OR 1,000+ active developers, OR partnership with Polymarket/Kalshi
markets.my_notes: Interesting meta-market: a prediction market about a prediction market infrastructure company. The 41% seems reasonable given the tight timeline and multiple success paths.

markets.title: Will Polyoptions volume hit $100 million in 2026?
markets.resolution_criteria: YES if >= $100M total 2026 trading volume (notional). Data from polyoptions.com by Jan 31, 2027. M&A preventing disaggregation = NO.
key_factors: Currently on testnet, no live trading yet
Options provide leverage/hedging not available in base prediction markets
markets.my_notes: 54% seems slightly high for a platform that hasn't launched yet. But the bull case (options on top of Polymarket's volume) is compelling. Would watch for launch announcements and early volume data.

markets.title: Will the Russia-Ukraine war end before the end of 2026?

observations.notes: Large +12 point move. Trump-Zelenskyy meetings late Dec, 'maybe very close' language, 20-point plan discussions, Paris talks scheduled Jan 7. Russia hasn't agreed to ceasefire yet, thorny issues remain.

markets.resolution_criteria: YES if formal peace agreement/armistice signed before end 2026 AND fighting stops with no major flare-ups (>100 deaths). Must last until later of: end 2026 or 1 month after signing. Temporary broken ceasefires don't count.
key_factors: Strict resolution criteria (formal agreement + lasting peace)
Note: 'identical market trading much higher' elsewhere - possible resolution criteria arbitrage
60 traders suggests moderate liquidity for Manifold
markets.my_notes: The comment about identical markets trading higher is interesting - suggests possible mispricing based on resolution criteria interpretation. Worth investigating cross-platform price differences. 41% feels roughly calibrated for formal peace by end of 2026.

metadata.notes: Initial data collection. Using Manifold markets as learning ground. Russia-Ukraine market showed significant movement (+12 points) based on diplomatic developments.

investigated_but_not_tracked.title: SSI will release a product in 2026
investigated_but_not_tracked.market_probability: unknown - couldn't find exact probability in multi-question market
investigated_but_not_tracked.reasoning: CEO explicitly stated 'a couple of years on R&D' before market entry (founded June 2024). Sutskever said 'first product will be the safe superintelligence... and it will not do anything else up until then.' No public product, API, or demo planned. $3B raised specifically to avoid commercial pressure. Business model is anti-product-cycle by design. For them to ship in 2026, their stated strategy would have to completely reverse.
investigated_but_not_tracked.status: would track if could find specific probability
investigated_but_not_tracked.action: if market price >40%, strong short; if <15%, no action

investigated_but_not_tracked.title: Anthropic will release a model classified as ASL-4 (2026)
investigated_but_not_tracked.reasoning: Claude Opus 4 (May 2025) is first ASL-3 model. Anthropic explicitly ruled out ASL-4 for Opus 4 AND stated that ASL-4 requires 'methods of assurance that are unsolved research problems today' like interpretability methods. For ASL-4 in 2026: (1) need model more capable than Opus 4, (2) hitting CBRN-4 or AI R&D-4 thresholds, (3) solving currently-unsolved assurance methods. 55% seems high - I estimate 30-35%. However, uncertainty is higher than Polyoptions because AI safety research timelines are less predictable.
investigated_but_not_tracked.action: would short at 55%; confidence is medium due to uncertainty about research progress
